### Tests
- test 1a. Tx with the IPFS address sent via HTTP  
- test 1b. Tx with 2Kb of text data sent via HTTP  
- test 2a. Tx with the IPFS address sent via HTTPS  
- test 2b. Tx with 2Kb of text data sent via HTTPS  
- test 3a. Tx with the IPFS address sent via HTTP over SSH tunnel  
- test 3b. Tx with 2Kb of text data sent via HTTP over SSH tunnel  
- test 4. 2Kb text file uploaded to IPFS via Infura node over HTTPS
- test 5. 2Kb + signature(s) sent to a MQTT server (w/o SSL/TLS encryption)

<pre>
Tests 1 .. 4 provide sending an Ethereum tx to a remote RPC server (node).<br />
"Under the hood", two RPC requests get sent for a transaction:
- eth_getTransactionCount - to obtain the nonce for a tx
- eth_sendRawTransaction - to broadcast the signed tx
<br />
<b><i>As an alternative option to Ethereum RPC requests,</i><br /></b>
test 5 provides sending the same 2Kb data, by several messages, to a remote MQTT server.
SSL/TLS encryption is not applied.<br />
For the sake of security, a strong signature to be included in every MQTT message. 
</pre>

### Network statistics

##### Tx sent via HTTP
<code><pre>
"Address A",       "Address B",      "Packets", "Bytes", "Packets A→B", "Bytes A→B", "Packets B→A", "Bytes B→A", comments
// test 1a. Address sent
"192.x.x.A:5341x", "192.x.x.B:8545", 20,        2586,    12,            1682         8,             904         "in total, for ifsAddress as data"
"192.x.x.A:53416", "192.x.x.B:8545", 10,        1138,    6,             718,         4,             420         "request #1 (eth_getTransactionCount)"
"192.x.x.A:53417", "192.x.x.B:8545", 10,        1448,    6,             964,         4,             484         "request #2a (eth_sendRawTransaction)"
// test 1b. File sent
"192.x.x.A:5385x", "192.x.x.B:8545", 23,        6859,    12,            5757,        11,           1102         "in total, for whole content as data"
"192.x.x.A:53855", "192.x.x.B:8545", 10,        1138,    6,             718,         4,             420         "request #1 (eth_getTransactionCount)"
"192.x.x.A:53856", "192.x.x.B:8545", 13,        5721,    6,             5039,        7,             682         "request #2b (eth_sendRawTransaction)"
</pre></code>

##### Tx sent via HTTPS
<code><pre>
"Address A",       "Address B",      "Packets", "Bytes", "Packets A→B", "Bytes A→B", "Packets B→A", "Bytes B→A", comments
// test 2a. Address sent
"192.x.x.A:5177x", "52.3.122.57:443", 21,       7742,    20,            3383,         14,           6954        "in total, for ifsAddress as data"
"192.x.x.A:51777", "52.3.122.57:443", 21,       7742,    12,            1625,         9,            6117        "connection openning + request #1"
"192.x.x.A:51778", "52.3.122.57"443", 13,       2595,    8,             1758,         5,            837         "request #2a + closing connection"
// test 2b. File sent
"192.x.x.A:5180x", "52.3.122.57:443", 36,       14573,   20,            7487,        16,            7086        "in total, for whole content as data"
"192.x.x.A:51805", "52.3.122.57:443", 21,       7742,    12,            1625,        9,             6117        "connection openning + request #1"
"192.x.x.A:51806", "52.3.122.57:443", 15,       6831,    8,             5862,        7,             969         "request #2b + closing connection"
</pre></code>

##### Tx sent via HTTP over SSH tunnel
<code><pre>
"Address A",       "Address B",      "Packets", "Bytes", "Packets A→B", "Bytes A→B", "Packets B→A", "Bytes B→A", comments
// test 3a. Address sent
"192.x.x.A:53816", "192.x.x.B:22",   101,        15499,   56,            8117,        45,           7382         "in total, for ifsAddress as data"
"192.x.x.A:53816", "192.x.x.B:22",   49,         9479,    25,            4531,        24,           4948         "~ connection openning"
"192.x.x.A:53816", "192.x.x.B:22",   52,         6020,    31,            3586,        21,           2434         "~ sending tx and closing connection"
// test 3b. File sent
"192.x.x.A:53874", "192.x.x.A:22",   104,        19777,   60,            12461,       44,           7316         "in total, for whole content as data"
</pre></code>

### HTTP(s) requests

##### request #1 - "eth_getTransactionCount"
<code><pre>
POST / HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json
Connection: keep-alive
Host: 192.x.x.B:8545
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Darwin x64) node.js/8.1.2 v8/5.8.283.41
Content-Length: 124
.
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"method":"eth_getTransactionCount","params":["0x26ede82D7132793883d8E5aa5f3e394F4539D3D8","latest"]}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json
Date: Mon, 17 Jul 2017 10:05:30 GMT
Content-Length: 40
.
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"0xa"}
</pre></code>
